DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to assess the efficacy of Diamel (dietary supplement) administration in the treatment of patients with type 2 diabetes receiving insulin therapy. The duration of this double-blind placebo controlled phase 3 clinical trial will be 24 weeks. The estimated number of patients to be recruited and randomized for the study is 116. Daily insulin requirements, blood glucose (fasting and post-prandial) concentrations, glycosylated hemoglobin (HbA1c), triglycerides and cholesterol will be assessed at the beginning and after 24 weeks of treatment.
DOC.brief_title: Diamel in the Treatment of Type 2 Diabetic Patients Receiving Insulin Therapy
DOC.criteria: Type 2 diabetes with insulin therapy regimen of two daily doses. Signed informed consent. Type 1 diabetes. Type 2 diabetes with glibenclamide treatment. Nephropathy or liver condition diagnosed by clinical and/or biochemical examination. Sepsis. Pregnancy. HbA1c values greater than 10%.
